A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Here’s the thing with Star Wars movies\, they inspire fanboys to show off how much of a Star Wars geek they are by allowing them to show everyone how much better they are at knowing what the story “should” be about than the filmmakers. You cannot trust their reviews\, they aren’t talking at all about the actual film\, only their disappointment in not being right in their predictions. That said\, I loved it. Did it go the way I thought it would? No\, but guess what\, that’s called a twist and is what keeps you guessing. It was long\, but you also have to consider that Carrie Fisher died shortly after her performance was filmed. They likely kept footage that may have otherwise made it to the cutting room floor to save time to give us just a few more moments with her. I can’t help but respect that. They played with the recurrent themes of the Star Wars trilogies but baiting and switching throughout the film nods to Empire Strikes Back and then throwing it sideways just when your mind begins to settle in and form expectations. The quality of Mark Hammil’s performance cannot be overstated. This was absolutely his finest performance and could be appreciated simply for his amazing\, completely convincing job back in the role of Like Skywalker. Do yourself a favor\, see the film\, it was - in my somewhat worthless opinion - one of the best Star Wars films yet.
